page.title: 14Wormleighton the canal
page.content: The South Oxford Canal makes two short appearances in the area, at the beginning and at the end of the tortuous length which encircles Wormleighton hill. There are no wharfs at Wormleighton. In the early nineteenth century the canal was used for transporting coal, limestone, lime, manure and also some passenger boats were operating. Now all the working boats are gone on this canal and it is used purely by pleasure craft with the occasional hotel boat and converted butty. From the canal can be seen the outline of a deserted village which is still used as a lecturing point by lecturers from Birmingham University.
